description: Primes of form n^2 + mu(n), where mu is A008683.
comments: All terms except for 3 are of the form n^2 + 1 where mu(n) = 1, since n^2 or n^2-1 can't be prime except for n=2. - _Robert Israel_, Oct 09 2015
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
maple: R:= select(t -> numtheory:-mobius(t)=1, [$3..10000]):2,3,op(select(isprime, map(t-> t^2+1, R))); # _Robert Israel_, Oct 09 2015
prog: (PARI) j=[]; for(n=1,3000,x=n^2+moebius(n); if(isprime(x),j=concat(j,x))); j(PARI) n=0; for (m=1, 10^5, x=m^2 + moebius(m); if (isprime(x), write("b062459.txt", n++, " ", x); if (n==1000, break))) \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Aug 08 2009(PARI) list(lim)=my(v=List([2]),t); forstep(n=2,sqrtint(lim\1),4, if(isprime(t=n^2+moebius(n)), listput(v,t))); Vec(v) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Sep 22 2015
author: Jason Earls (zevi_35711(AT)yahoo.com), Jul 26 2001
